description: MVP implementation of psychological UX patterns for workout adherence - milestone badges, rest days, progress rings, recovery flows

userStories.title: Lifetime Milestone Badges System
userStories.description: As a user, I want to earn permanent badges for workout milestones so my progress is never lost even if I take breaks.
acceptanceCriteria: Add milestone thresholds: 1, 10, 25, 50, 100, 250, 365, 500, 1000 workouts
Create MilestoneBadge component with earned/locked states
Badge unlock triggers on workout completion when threshold crossed
Full-screen celebration modal on badge unlock with animation
Profile/achievements page showing all badges with progress to next
Badge quotes for each tier (see 236-design-concepts.md)
Share card generation for earned badges
Badges persist forever - never lost on breaks
Mobile-first responsive design
userStories.notes: Foundation feature. Extends existing AchievementType. Reference 236-design-concepts.md Concept 5 for wireframes.

userStories.title: Rest Day Affirmation Screen
userStories.description: As a user, I want rest days to feel like progress (not absence) so I don't feel guilty for not working out.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect rest days from program schedule (non-workout days)
Dashboard variant for rest days - different visual treatment
Praise/progress section: show lifetime stats, weekly progress, encouraging message
Educational coaching content: why rest works, muscle growth science (rotating)
Optional activity logging: nutrition, stretching, foam rolling, extra workout
Activity log is zero-pressure (optional, clearly labeled)
'Go HAM' option - let users do another workout if they want
Weekly progress indicator shows [R] for rest days (protected, not missed)
Rest days NEVER break any streak or consistency metric
Mobile-first calmer visual design (less saturated colors)
userStories.notes: User feedback: B=praise, C=log options, D=coaching. Reference 236-design-concepts.md Concept 4.

userStories.title: Quick Log - I Did It Button
userStories.description: As a busy user, I want to quickly confirm I completed a workout without full logging so I maintain consistency even when rushed.
acceptanceCriteria: One-tap 'I Did It' button on dashboard for scheduled workout days
Counts toward weekly progress and lifetime totals
Option to backfill details later (within 48 hours)
Works for: gym without phone, travel workouts, busy days
Visual confirmation on tap (checkmark animation)
Appears alongside 'Start Full Workout' - not a replacement
Clear messaging: 'Log that you worked out'
Updates completion ring immediately
userStories.notes: High impact, low effort. Reduces friction for maintaining consistency.

userStories.title: First Workout Celebration
userStories.description: As a new user, I want my first workout to feel special so I'm motivated to come back for workout #2.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect first workout completion per user
Full-screen celebration with tasteful confetti (2-3 sec max)
Day One badge unlocked with special quote
Show workout stats: sets completed, total volume lifted
Share card generation for social
Differentiated from subsequent workout completions (subsequent = shorter celebration)
Auto-advance after 5s if no interaction
Schedule 24h follow-up: 'Ready for workout #2?' (excitement, not guilt)
Uses milestone badge system for Day One badge
userStories.notes: Peak-end rule. Critical moment - 4/5 dropout risk. Reference 236-design-concepts.md Concept 2.

userStories.title: Completion Ring + Weekly Progress
userStories.description: As a user, I want a visual ring showing my weekly workout progress so I can see how close I am to completing my week.
acceptanceCriteria: SVG ring component with animated fill on completion
Shows 'X of Y workouts this week' in center
Day indicators below ring: [check] completed, [arrow] today, [R] rest, [empty] scheduled
Weekly framing (not daily) - protects rest days
Ring colors: navy stroke, coral fill (brand colors)
Desktop: split view with ring left, workout card right
Mobile: ring takes ~40% viewport above fold
Copy variants by progress (see 236-design-concepts.md)
Accessible: screen reader announces progress
Smooth animation on workout completion
userStories.notes: Apple-proven pattern. Zeigarnik effect. Reference 236-design-concepts.md Concept 1.

userStories.title: Missed Workout Recovery Flow
userStories.description: As a user who missed workouts, I want a supportive recovery path so I can get back on track without shame.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect absence: 1 day missed vs 3+ days absent
Recovery screen shown on return (before home, once per absence)
1-day miss: 'Welcome back' + progress safe messaging
3+ days: 'No judgment' + lifetime progress emphasis
Show: total workouts, week/program progress, volume lifted
Options: Today's Workout (full), Quick Session (3 exercises, 20 min), Not Today (defer)
Quick Comeback Workout generator: 3 compound movements, 50% sets, 70% weights
Program adjustment offer for 3+ day absence ('Make it easier' option)
'Not today' schedules reminder for tomorrow (not guilt-based)
Never shows on rest days
Track analytics: recovery shown -> option selected -> workout completed
userStories.notes: Addresses #1 dropout cause (shame spiral). Reference 236-design-concepts.md Concept 3.

userStories.title: Week 2 Check-in Intervention
userStories.description: As a user in week 2, I want a proactive check-in so I can adjust my program before I quit.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect Week 2 of program (around workout 5-8 depending on schedule)
Check-in modal/screen: 'How's it going?'
Options: Going great, Too hard, Too easy, Life got in the way
Show original goals as reminder
Program difficulty adjustment flow if 'Too hard' selected
Reduce volume/frequency options
Encouraging message regardless of selection
Only shows once per program
Track: check-in shown -> option selected -> week 3 retention
userStories.notes: 50%+ users quit by Week 2. Critical intervention point.

userStories.title: Weekly Summary Notification
userStories.description: As a user, I want a weekly summary push notification so I can see my progress at a glance.
acceptanceCriteria: Weekly notification (Sunday evening or Monday morning - configurable)
Content: workouts completed this week, total volume, streak/consistency status
Positive framing regardless of performance
Deep link to dashboard/progress view
Respects notification preferences (can disable)
Does not stack with other notifications same day
userStories.notes: User requested weekly pushes as default. Low pressure, informational.

userStories.title: Program Completion Notification
userStories.description: As a user who finishes a program, I want to be notified and celebrated so the milestone feels meaningful.
acceptanceCriteria: Detect program completion (all scheduled workouts done)
Push notification: 'You completed [Program Name]!'
Deep link to completion summary screen
Summary shows: total workouts, volume progress, time invested
Before/after stats comparison (Week 1 vs final week)
Program completion badge earned
Share card for social
Prompt for next program selection
userStories.notes: Important milestone celebration. Transitions user to next program.
